publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5416 David McLetchie: 300th Anniversary of the Act of Union—That the Parliament notes that 16 January 2007 is the 300th anniversary of the passing of the Act of Union by the Scottish Parliament; believes that the union has been one of the greatest political success stories of modern European history; recognises that the union continues to contribute massively to our culture, strength, stability and prosperity while enabling each of the constituent parts to retain its proud sense of national and local identity; is convinced that all four countries that make up the United Kingdom benefit from the union and that we continue to achieve much more together than we would as separate nations, and invites all supporters of the union of all political persuasions and of none to use the 300th anniversary to reiterate the case for, and continued relevance of, the union for this century and beyond.

S2M-5416 300th Anniversary of the Act of Union (lodged on 15 January 2007) Derek Brownlee*, Murray Tosh*, Alex Johnstone*, Mr David Davidson*, Murdo Fraser*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Dave Petrie*, Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-5416 300th Anniversary of the Act of Union (lodged on 15 January 2007) Margaret Mitchell*, Bill Aitken*, Phil Gallie*

S2M-5416 David McLetchie: 300th Anniversary of the Act of Union—That the Parliament notes that 16 January 2007 is the 300th anniversary of the passing of the Act of Union by the Scottish Parliament; believes that the union has been one of the greatest political success stories of modern European history; recognises that the union continues to contribute massively to our culture, strength, stability and prosperity while enabling each of the constituent parts to retain its proud sense of national and local identity; is convinced that all four countries that make up the United Kingdom benefit from the union and that we continue to achieve much more together than we would as separate nations, and invites all supporters of the union of all political persuasions and of none to use the 300th anniversary to reiterate the case for, and continued relevance of, the union for this century and beyond. Supported by: Derek Brownlee, Murray Tosh, Alex Johnstone, Mr David Davidson, Murdo Fraser, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Dave Petrie, Mrs Nanette Milne, Margaret Mitchell, Bill Aitken, Phil Gallie
S2M-5416 300th Anniversary of the Act of Union (lodged on 15 January 2007) Bristow Muldoon*
S2M-5416 300th Anniversary of the Act of Union (lodged on 15 January 2007) John Scott*
S2M-5416 300th Anniversary of the Act of Union (lodged on 15 January 2007) Alex Fergusson*

S2M-5416 David McLetchie: 300th Anniversary of the Act of Union—That the Parliament notes that 16 January 2007 is the 300th anniversary of the passing of the Act of Union by the Scottish Parliament; believes that the union has been one of the greatest political success stories of modern European history; recognises that the union continues to contribute massively to our culture, strength, stability and prosperity while enabling each of the constituent parts to retain its proud sense of national and local identity; is convinced that all four countries that make up the United Kingdom benefit from the union and that we continue to achieve much more together than we would as separate nations, and invites all supporters of the union of all political persuasions and of none to use the 300th anniversary to reiterate the case for, and continued relevance of, the union for this century and beyond. Supported by: Derek Brownlee, Murray Tosh, Alex Johnstone, Mr David Davidson, Murdo Fraser, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Dave Petrie, Mrs Nanette Milne, Margaret Mitchell, Bill Aitken, Phil Gallie, Bristow Muldoon, John Scott, Alex Fergusson
